method.comment: The method used to remove the item

device.comment: The device used to remove the item

example: [Remove]{operation} [all traces of fluid]{reagent1} by [aspiration]{method}.
[Discard]{operation} the [protein solution]{reagent1}

reagent1.comment: The primary reagent to which other reagents are added

reagent2.comment: Additional reagents to be added to the primary reagent

ratio.comment: The ratio of reagents to be added, if applicable

concentration.comment: The final concentration of the reagent to be added, if applicable

example: [Add]{operation} [1 µl lysis buffer (LB)]{reagent2} into each [PCR tube that contains samples and 1st NTC]{reagent1}.
[Apply]{operation} [a drop of normal goat serum]{reagent2} to each [specimen]{reagent1}.

source.comment: The source from where the sample is being transferred

destination.comment: The destination where the sample is being transferred

equipment.comment: Any equipment used during the transfer

example: [Transfer]{operation} the [frozen samples]{reagent1} to a [storage box]{destination}.
[Pour]{operation} the [extract]{reagent1} onto the [filter paper]{destination}.
[Move]{operation} the [needle tip]{reagent1} to [the hole]{destination}.
[Decant]{operation} the [supernatant]{reagent1}.
[Return]{operation} the [remaining blood]{reagent1} to the [jugular vein]{destination}.

thermoProgram.comment: when "device"=thermocycler, this parameter should be changed to REQ

example: [Incubate]{operation} [protein-DNA complexes]{reagent1} at [ambient temperature]{temperature} for [30 minutes]{time} [prior to measurements]{notice}.
[Immerse]{operation} the [tissue]{reagent1} into [20% THF in water]{reagent2} in a [screw-capped glass bottle]{device} for at least [1 hour]{time} at [room temperature]{temperature}.

reagent2.comment: The medium or buffer in which the reagent is suspended

example: [Suspend]{operation} [1-5 million cells]{reagent1} in the [labeling medium]{reagent2} for [10 min]{time} at [37 ˚C]{temperature}.
[Resuspend]{operation} [sperm pellet]{reagent1} in [10 uL PBS]{reagent2}.

reagent1.comment: The type of cells to be plated

density.comment: The density of cells to be plated per cm^2 or per well

example: [Plate]{operation} [hOBs]{reagent1} at a density of [3000 cells/cm^2]{density} in [growth media]{reagent2}.

container.comment: The container where the item will be collected

source.comment: The source where the sample is collected

method.comment: The method used to collect the item

environment.comment: The condition under which the item is collected

example: [Collect]{operation} all the [cell culture media]{reagent1} in the [well]{source} into a [15 ml tube]{container} [using a pipette]{method}.
[Obtain]{operation} the [brain]{reagent1} from [C57 Black/6 mice (16–21 days old for cerebellar slices, 6-8 weeks old for hippocampal slices)]{source}.
[Capture]{operation} [biotinylated thrombin with streptavidin agarose]{reagent1}.
[Harvest]{operation} [embryonic day 13.5 mouse embryos]{reagent1} from [pregnant female mice]{source}.

reagent1.comment: The main reagent to be mixed

ratio.comment: The ratio of reagents to be mixed

method.comment: The method of mixing, such as inversion, vortexing, pipetting, etc.

example: [Mix]{operation} [10 μg total RNA]{reagent1} with [Loading Buffer]{reagent2} [1:1]{ratio}.
[Combine]{operation} the [topoisomerase I-relaxed circular DNA (in tube B)]{reagent1} and [core histones (in tube A)]{reagent2}.

targetConcentration.comment: The final concentration of the diluted reagent

example: [Dilute]{operation} the [Rhodamine fluorescently labelled Ultra-Magnetic Liposomes (UMLs)]{reagent1} in a [10mM Hepes pH 7.4, 20mM Na3Citrate, 108mM NaCl buffer solution]{reagent2} to a final concentration of [0.1M]{targetConcentration}.
[Dissolve]{operation} the [precipitate]{reagent1} in [50 mM Tris-HCl, pH 7.5, 0.15 M NaCl]{reagent2} at a concentration of [3 mg/ml]{targetConcentration}.
[Shake]{operation} at [4,800 rpm]{intensity} for [50 seconds]{time} by the [Mini Beadbeater]{device} to [remove epithelial cells]{purpose}.

intensity.comment: The intensity at which to centrifuge the sample, usually represented as rpm/xg/rcf

time.comment: The duration for which to centrifuge the sample

example: [Centrifuge]{operation} the [samples]{reagent1} at [2,000 rpm]{intensity} for [20 min]{time} at [room temperature]{temperature}.

method.comment: The method used to purify the reagent

device.comment: The device used for purification

example: [Purify]{operation} the [PCR products]{reagent1} by [QIAquick PCR purification column]{device}.

reagent2.comment: The item to replace with, defult = another brand new reagent

example: [Replace]{operation} [ultrapure water \(1.8 mL) in the recording chamber]{reagent1} with an [equivalent volume of degassed 0.5 mM CaCl<sub>2</sub> BSS]{reagent2} at [18°C]{temperature} using [a long needle Hamilton syringe]{device}.
[Change]{operation} [half of the culture medium]{reagent1} (iii) [every other day]{frequency}.

device.comment: The device used for measurement

wavelength.comment: Wavelength used for measurement if applicable

example: [Measure]{operation} [absorbance]{parameter} of the [sample]{reagent1} at [550 nm]{wavelength} for [2 min]{time}.
[Determine]{operation} the [DNA concentration]{parameter} using a [spectrophotometer]{device}.

reagent2.comment: Additional reagents to be aspirated if any

device.comment: Device used for aspiration

example: [Aspirate]{operation} the [collagen type I solution]{reagent1}.
[Coat]{operation} [samples]{reagent1} with [gold]{reagent2} using [sputter coater]{device}.

reagent2.comment: The material used to rinse the object,defult = water

repeat.comment: Number of times the object should be rinsed, default=1

example: [Rinse]{operation} the [wafer]{reagent1} in [DI water]{reagent2} for [10 seconds]{time}.
[Wash]{operation} the [slides]{reagent1} in [0.01M PBS]{reagent2} for [5 min]{time} [three times]{repeat}.
[Flush]{operation} [colony]{reagent1} with [Williams'E +  10%FCS]{reagent2}

component.comment: The part to be eluted from the reagent

method.comment: Method used for elution, e.g., centrifugation, boiling, shaking

example: [Elute]{operation} [DNA]{component} from [beads]{reagent1} by adding [50 μl above elution buffer]{reagent2}.

device.comment: default=standard vortexer

example: [Vortex]{operation} the [tube]{reagent1} [vigorously]{intensity} for [2 minutes]{time} with the [“vortex rack”]{device}.
[Thaw]{operation} [TRI reagent lysed cells]{reagent1} [on ice]{environment}.

reagent3.comment: The other reagent used for passaging

example: [Passage]{operation} the [cells]{reagent1} in [MEF media]{reagent2} [at least once]{repeat}.

device.comment: The method used for this operation

example: [Pellet]{operation} the [cells]{reagent1} at [2000 g]{intensity} for [5 min]{time} at [room temperature]{temperature}.
[Digest]{operation} [proteins]{reagent1} with [recombinant trypsin (30:1 ratio protein/trypsin)]{reagent2} [over night]{time} at [37˚C]{temperature} [with shaking]{notice}.

component.comment: The part to be extracted from the reagent1

device.comment: The kit used for extraction

example: [Extract]{operation} the [plasmid DNA]{component} with [phenol]{reagent2}, [chloroform]{reagent2} and [isoamyl alcohol]{reagent2}.

reagent1.comment: The source from which the volume is pipetted

destination.comment: The destination where the volume is pipetted to

repeat.comment: The number of times the pipetting action is repeated

tip.comment: The type of pipette tip used

example: [Pipette]{operation} [10 µl]{volume} stock of [single cell suspension]{reagent1} into the [dish]{destination}.
[Concentrate]{operation} [eluate]{reagent1} in [speedvac]{device} to [22.5 ÂµL]{targetVol}.
notice: Unlike DILUTE, CONCENTRATE mostly indicates the target volume rather than the target concentration.
To accurately express the meaning, here use parameter "targetVol" instead of the old parameter "Volume", to avoid being mistaken for the volume of the reagent to be concentrated.
Some protocols do not provide any parameters, such as "Concentrate if necessary"

example: [Sterilize]{operation} the [medium]{reagent1} in an [autoclave]{device} at [110oC]{temperature} for [15 minutes]{time}.

component.comment: The portion of the reagent1 that needs to be precipitated

method.comment: Method of precipitation, e.g., shaking, spinning, etc.

example: [Precipitate]{operation} the [RNA]{component} from the [aqueous phase]{reagent1} by mixing with [isopropyl alcohol]{reagent2}.
[Quench]{operation} [staining]{reagent1} by adding [150µL staining buffer]{reagent2}.

device.comment: The device used for flow(At least provide one of "device" or "reagent2")

flowRate.comment: The rate at which the reagent is flowed

example: [Flow]{operation} the [worm suspension]{reagent1} through the [filtering device]{device} to [remove debris]{purpose}.

device.comment: The device used for normalization

method.comment: The method used for normalization

example: [Normalize]{operation} [samples]{reagent1} for protein concentration (recommended concentration: [between 0.3 and 0.6 µg/µl]{concentration}).

volume.comment: The volume of the reagent to be dispensed (Volume per serving)

container.comment: The container where the reagent will be dispensed

device.comment: The device used to dispense the reagent

example: [Dispense]{operation} [1 ml]{volume} of the [virus preparation]{reagent1} in a [pre-labeled TruCool cryovial]{container}.
notice: Be careful not to create bubbles when dispensing.
Dispense medium on the inner wall of the well and not directly on the Matrigel droplet.

environment.comment: Operating environment, such as N2 or water bath

example: [Evaporate]{operation} the [tube]{reagent1} under [N2]{environment} in a [water bath]{environment} with [30-40 C]{temperature}.
[Aliquot]{operation} [23 µl]{volume} of [master mix]{reagent1} into each [PCR tube]{container} [on ice]{environment}.

destination.comment: The location where the reagent1 is to be placed

example: [Place]{operation} all [PCR tubes]{reagent1} into the [thermo cycler]{destination}.
[Put]{operation} [resected tumors]{reagent1} to a [petri dish]{destination} [on ice]{environment}.
[Position]{operation} [both ends of the artery]{reagent1} over the [opposing glass cannula in the bath chamber]{destination}.

device.comment: Device used to cut the object

size.comment: Size of the sections to be cut

direction.comment: Direction in which the object is cut, including preposition

environment.comment: Any specific environment under which the object is cut

example: [Cut]{operation} each [hemisphere]{reagent1} [along the caudal to rostral]{direction} direction.

reagent2.comment: The fixative to be used, or The place to fix the reagent1

example: [Fix]{operation} samples with [glutaraldehyde fixative]{reagent2} at [4°C]{temperature} [overnight]{time}.

device.comment: Device used for drying

environment.comment: Operating environment, such as vacuum or nitrogen

example: [Dry]{operation} the [product]{reagent1} in an [oven]{device} at [60 °C]{temperature} for [24 h]{time}.
[Heat]{operation} the [tube containing RNA and adapter]{reagent1} to [70°C]{temperature} for [2 minutes]{time}.

reagent1.comment: The main reagent to be prepared

example: [Prepare]{operation} [1 ml of [PBS]{reagent1} in [1.5 ml Eppendorf tube]{container}.

environment.comment: Environment under which the procedure is performed

repeat.comment: Number of times the procedure is repeated

example: [Perform]{operation} a second round of [purification]{procedure} with [Ni-nitrilotriacetic acid (NTA) agarose (Qiagen)]{reagent1}.
[Process]{operation} the [lysate]{procedure} for [DNA isolation]{purpose} by [phenol-chloroform extraction]{method}.
[Carry]{operation} out [additional nested PCR reactions]{procedure} using the [products obtained from the first round of inverse PCR]{reagent1}.

reagent1.comment: The animal or organ to be perfused

method.comment: Method used for perfusion, such as transcardially

reagent0.comment: The animal or organ after perfusing

example: [Perfuse]{operation} the [mice]{reagent1} [systemically]{method} with [10 ml of HBSS containing 20 mM EDTA]{reagent2} via the [left ventricle]{location} using [21-gauge butterfly needle connected to [Peristaltic pump P-1]{device}.

reagent1.comment: The reagent to be spun down

intensity.comment: The intensity at which the spin should be performed, default=appropriate intensity

time.comment: The duration for which the spin should be performed, default=appropriate time

temperature.comment: The temperature at which the spin should be performed, default=room temperature

device.comment: The device to be used for spinning, default=centrifuge

example: [Spin]{operation} down [cells]{reagent1} at [440 g]{intensity} for [5 minutes]{time} at [4°C]{temperature}.

reagent1.comment: The reagent to be taken out or used

source.comment: The location from where the reagent is to be taken out

example: [Take]{operation} [100 µL]{volume} of the [bacterial culture]{reagent1}.
[Bring]{operation} [the NucleoMag bead cleaned indexed cpn60 amplicon libraries from D]{reagent1} to [room temperature]{environment}.
[Store]{operation} the [tissues]{reagent1} in [cyrotubes]{container} [on dry ice]{environment} and [at -80°C]{temperature}.
[Keep]{operation} [tubes]{reagent1} [on ice]{environment}.

method.comment: The method used to check the item

device.comment: The device used to check the item

example: [Check]{operation} the [density]{attribute} of [single cell suspension]{reagent1} under a [dissecting microscope using 5X objective lens]{device}.
[Monitor]{operation} [DP values]{attribute} on the [screen]{device}.
[Observe]{operation} the [cells]{reagent1} under a [fluorescence microscope]{device} to [check for fluorescence and determine whether the transfection was successful]{purpose}.
[Examine]{operation} [proteins in the preparation]{reagent1} by [SDS-PAGE (18% polyacrylamide)]{method}.

reagent2.comment: Additional reagents used during the run, such as supporting medium

program.comment: when "device"=PCR machine(thermocycler), this parameter should be changed to REQ

example: [Run]{operation} [10 ul or 200 ng of ligation products]{reagent1} on [1% agarose gel with 0.5 ug/ml ethidium bromide in 1X TAE buffer]{reagent2}.

destination.comment: The location where the reagent is to be loaded

method.comment: The method used to load the reagent

example: [Load]{operation} [images]{reagent1} on to [FIJI]{destination} using the [drag and drop method]{method}.

formula.comment: The formula to be used for calculation

variables.comment: The variables involved in the calculation

software.comment: The software used for calculation if any

example: [Calculate]{operation} the [Coefficient of Variation (CV)]{attribute} for each triplicate by the below formulation: [CV = Cq Std.]{formula}

requirement.comment: The requirement of the selected reagent or data

device.comment: The device(usually tool) for selection

example: [Select]{operation} [Top 20 precursor ions]{reagent1} for [fragmentation]{purpose}.

reagent1.comment: reagent to be counted(usually cell), keep alive

method.comment: Method used for counting cells, such as 'hemocytometer', 'cell counter', 'Trypan Blue method', etc.

reagent2.comment: Stain used for cell counting, if applicable

device.comment: Device used for cell counting, such as 'Countess Machine', 'hemocytometer', etc.

example: [Count]{operation} [live cells]{reagent1} using [cell counter]{device} and [trypan blue live dead stain]{reagent2}.

data1.comment: The value to adjust the attribute to

method.comment: The method used to adjust, if applicable

example: [Adjust]{operation} [direct halogen illumination]{reagent1} to [appropriate intensity]{data1} [for the operation]{purpose}.

reagent2/destination.comment: The destination where the reagent1 is injected

example: [Inject]{operation} [worm suspension]{reagent1} into the [device]{destination} using [pressure driven flow]{method}.
[Administer]{operation} [1000 IU of heparin]{reagent1} [intravenously]{method}.

filter.comment: Type of filter to be used

container.comment: Container to collect the filtered reagent

example: [Filter]{operation} the [10mL of DPBS containing cells]{reagent1} through the same [40 μm cell strainer]{filter}.

data1.comment: The data to be analyzed, a ANALYZE instruction can either has "reagent1" or "data1", but cannot have neither or both

environment.comment: The condition under which the data was collected

method.comment: The method used for analysis

example: [Analyze]{operation} [each point of the calibration curve]{data1} using [RP-HPLC-DAD]{device}.
[Evaluate]{operation} the [size]{data1} of the [patches]{reagent1}.
[Leave]{operation} [the plates]{reagent1} [untouched}{notice} for [15-20 minutes]{time}.

container.comment: The container where the pooling will take place

example: [Pool]{operation} [liquid]{reagent1} in a [flask]{container}.

device.comment: The device to be turned on or off

state.comment: The state to which the device should be turned, either 'on' or 'off'

setting.comment: Any additional settings or adjustments to be made to the device

example: [Turn]{operation} the [laser]{device} [off]{state}.

reagent1.comment: The reagent from which "component" is to be separated, keep alive

method.comment: The method used to separate the objects

device.comment: The device used to separate the objects

environment.comment: The condition under which the separation is performed

example: [Separate]{operation} the [colon]{component} from the [jejunum/ileum]{reagent1}.
[Isolate]{operation} [CD34+ cells]{component} from [CBMCs]{reagent1} with the [Miltenyi human CD34 Microbead Kit]{device}.
[Dissociate]{operation} [lungs]{component} using the [Miltenyi lung dissociation kit and GentleMACS tissue dissociator]{device}

reagent1.comment: The cells or organism to be grown

reagent2.comment: The medium in which the cells or organism are grown

environment.comment: Additional growth conditions, such as CO2 concentration or shaking speed

device.comment: The device in which the cells or organism are grown

example: [Grow]{operation} [D. melanogaster larvae]{reagent1} at [18°C]{temperature} in [fly bottles]{container} on [standard fly food]{reagent2}.
[Fill]{operation} the [syringe]{container} with [1.0 μl of AAV-DIO-ChR2]{reagent1}.

reagent1.comment: The reagent to be weighed, keep alive

container.comment: The container to hold the reagent1

device.comment: The device used to weigh the reagent1, default=electric balance

example: [Weigh]{operation} [10 g]{weight} [fresh silage]{reagent1}.

reagent2.comment: The material used to seal the container

device.comment: Device used for sealing if any

example: [Seal]{operation} the [vial]{reagent1} with a [Teflon lined screw cap]{reagent2}.
[Close]{operation} all [phrenic veins]{reagent1} using [4-0 PROLENE stitches]{device}.

reagent1.comment: The type of cells to be seeded

cellDensity.comment: The density of cells to be seeded per unit area or volume

container.comment: The type of well or plate to be used for seeding

wellCount.comment: Number of wells used for seeding

reagent2.comment: The medium in which cells are to be seeded

coating.comment: The coating on the well or plate, if any

environment.comment: The conditions under which the seeded cells are to be incubated

example: [Seed]{operation} [2x10e5 cells/well]{cellDensity} (12well plate) on [vitronectin-coated plate]{container}.

reagent1.comment: The main component to be assembled

reagent2.comment: Additional components to be assembled with the main component

instructions.comment: Specific instructions or manufacturer's instructions for assembly

device.comment: Device or equipment used for assembly

example: [Assemble]{operation} a [MinElute spin column]{reagent1} in a [new collection tube]{reagent2}.
[Proceed]{operation} with [PCR setup]{procedure}.

time.comment: The time to wait, if specified

termination.comment: The timing to stop waiting, a WAIT instruction must has one of "time" or "termination"

environment.comment: The condition to be met before proceeding

example: [Wait]{operation} [5 min]{time} until [enough cancer cells are trapped at the cell docking area]{termination}.

environment.comment: The physical environment under which reagent1 is cooled, such as "ice bath" or "in the dark"

example: [Cool]{operation} down the [sample]{reagent1} [in the dark]{environment} at [room temperature]{temperature} for [10 min]{time}.
[Freeze]{operation} the [compound]{reagent1} in [cooled 2-methyl butane]{container} in a [liquid nitrogen bath]{device}.

[Freeze]{operation} the [cells]{reagent1} at [a cooling rate of -1oC/min]{environment} using [CoolCell® alcohol-free cell freezing container]{device} in a [-80oC freezer]{storage} or [dry ice locker]{storageAlternative}.
[Freeze]{operation} the [chromatin sample]{reagent1} rapidly and [store]{operation} at [-80 °C]{storage}.

[Freeze]{operation} [cell stocks]{reagent1}: Prepare [cell freezing medium]{solution} as follows: [chilled FBS 90%, DMSO 10%, keep on ice]{solutionComposition}; [collect]{operation} all [cell clusters]{reagent2}; [centrifuge]{operation2} and [resuspend]{operation3} cells with [freezing medium]{solution}; [transfer]{operation4} cryogenic vials immediately to [Mr. Frosty™ Freezing Container]{container} and [keep]{operation5} in [-80 °C freezer]{storage} for [24 hours]{time}; [transfer]{operation5} cell vials to [liquid nitrogen tank]{storage2}.

environment.comment: The physical environment under which reagent1 is freezed, such as "liquid nitrogen bath"

example: [Freeze]{operation} the [compound]{reagent1} in [cooled 2-methyl butane]{reagent2} in a [liquid nitrogen bath]{environment}.
[Treat]{operation} for [30 minutes]{time} at [37°C]{temperature}.

reagent2.comment: The reagent(usually solution) used for blocking

example: [Block]{operation} the [membrane]{reagent1} with [10% fat-free skim milk in TBST buffer]{reagent2} for [1hr]{time} at [room temperature]{temperature}.

method.comment: The method used for quantification

device.comment: The device used for quantification

example: [Quantify]{operation} the [DNA]{reagent1} using [Qubit]{device}.

reagent2.comment: Additional reagents used for staining(usually staining agent)

method.comment: Specific staining method if applicable

example: [Stain]{operation} [cells]{reagent1} at [4°C]{temperature} for [30 minutes]{time}.
[Record]{operation} [3D TROSY-HNCA, 3D MQ-CCH-TOCSY and 4D 13C, 15N-edited NOESY]{information} for [resonance assignment]{purpose}.

reagent1/data1/device.comment: The reagent/data/device to be checked or ensured

state.comment: The state needs to be ensured

example: [Ensure]{operation} that the [laser]{device} is [on]{state} during these [2.5 minutes]{time}.
[Maintain]{operation} [virulent stocks]{state} by [performing _in vivo_ passage every 6-12 months]{method}.
[Confirm]{operation} the [quality]{state} of the [conjugation]{device}.

reagent2.comment: The material used to cover the object

example: [Cover]{operation} the [plate]{reagent1} with [foil]{reagent2} to [protect it from light]{purpose}.

reagent1.comment: The column or device to be equilibrated

reagent2.comment: The buffer or solution used for equilibration

example: [Equilibrate]{operation} [NEST MicroSpin C18 reverse phase column]{reagent1} with [100 µl of methanol]{reagent2} by [centrifuging at 110 g for 1 minute]{method}.

reagent2.comment: The reagent where reagent1 needs to be inoculated(usually medium)

container.comment: The container where reagent1 needs to be inoculated,a INOCULATE instruction must has one of "reagent2" or "container"

example: [Inoculate]{operation} [10 ml of YPAD medium]{reagent2} with a [single fresh AH109 colony]{reagent1}.

volume.comment: The volume of the sample to be saved

purpose.comment: The purpose for saving the sample

device.comment: The storage condition for the saved sample

format.comment: The format in which the sample/data is to be saved

example: [Save]{operation} [the selected ROI]{reagent1} [for use in all future experiments]{purpose}.

method.comment: The method or kit used to generate the target

parameter.comment: Additional parameters or conditions for the operation

example: [Generate]{operation} [a continuous 1 kHz signal]{target} with the [function generator]{method}.

reagent2.comment: Additional reagents used in the amplification process

program.comment: PCR program to be used for amplification

example: [Amplify]{operation} [inserts]{reagent1} using [Taq DNA polymerase]{reagent2}.

program.comment: when device=Covaris Adaptive focused ultrasonicator, this parameter should be changed to REQ

example: [Sonicate]{operation} [chromatin solution]{reagent1} [4 times]{repeat} for [10 seconds]{time} (continuous) with [power output setting at 10]{notice} using [Fisher sonic 60 dismembrator]{device}.

method.comment: The method of administration of the anesthetic

example: [Anesthetize]{operation} [mice]{reagent1} with [ketamine \(100mg/kg)/xylaxine \(10mg/kg) mixture]{reagent2}.

reagent2.comment: The object to which the first object is attached

method.comment: The method used to attach

device.comment: The tool used to attach

position.comment: The position where the object is attached

reagent0.comment: Products after connecting reagent1 and reagent2

example: [Attach]{operation} both [Hamilton syringes with 26 gauge needles]{reagent1} to the [stereotaxic apparatus]{reagent2}.

reagent1/object.comment: The reagent or object to be cleaned

device.comment: Specific cleaning kit if used

example: [Clean]{operation} [all surfaces and centrifuges]{object} with [an RNase eliminating solution]{reagent1}.

device.comment: default=magnetic stir bar

intensity.comment: The intensity at which to centrifuge the sample, usually represented as rpm/xg/rcf

example: [Stir]{operation} the [solution]{mixture} for [5 minutes]{time}.
[Swirl]{operation} [mastermix bottle]{reagent1} [gently]{notice} to [mix]{purpose}.

device.comment: Any tools used during dissection

location.comment: The location where the dissection is performed

example: [Dissect]{operation} out [mouse embryos]{reagent1} in [DMEM + 25 mM HEPES]{reagent2}

reagent1.comment: The reagent to be passed through

device.comment: The device or material to pass the reagent through

repeat.comment: Number of times the process is repeated

example: [Pass]{operation} the [supernatant]{reagent1} through a [100 nm Nylon mesh]{device} into a [50 ml tube]{container}.

volume.comment: The volume of the reagent to be drawn

device.comment: The device used to draw the reagent, such as a syringe or pipette

destination.comment: The destination of the drawn reagent, if applicable

example: [Draw]{operation} up [5 μL]{volume} of the [cell slurry]{reagent1} for [a single ATO]{purpose} using a [10 or 20 μL pipette tip]{device}.

reagent1/data1.comment: The reagent(usually cells) or data to be sorted

container.comment: The container to collect sorted cells(usually tube)

reagent2.comment: The buffer to be used during sorting

device.comment: The device used for sorting, default=FACS

program.comment: The program used for sorting data

example: [Sort]{operation} [cells]{reagent1} into a [5ml tube containing cold PBS/10% FBS]{container}.

angle.comment: The angle of rotation in degrees

example: [Rotate]{operation} the [tube]{reagent1} for [10 min]{time} at [room T]{temperature}.

device1.comment: The first device to be connected

device2.comment: The second device to be connected

connector.comment: The connector used to connect the devices

sequence.comment: The sequence of connecting the devices if it matters

device.comment: Products after connecting device1 and device2

example: [Connect]{operation} [optical fibers]{device1} via a [FC/PC adaptor]{connector} to a [473 nm blue or 561 nm yellow laser diode and stimulator]{device2} to [generate blue or yellow light pulses]{purpose}.

destination.comment: The destination where the object will be split into

ratio.comment: The ratio for splitting the object

volume.comment: The volume of each split part

number.comment: The number of parts to split the object into

environment.comment: The condition under which the object should be split

example: [Split]{operation} the [culture]{reagent1} in [10 tubes]{destination}, (each with [20mL]{volume}).

direction.comment: The direction in which the object is pulled

device.comment: The device used to pull the object

settings.comment: The settings used on the device

position.comment: The position to which the object is pulled

example: [Pull]{operation} the [stitches of the back wall]{reagent1} [cephalad]{direction}.

device.comment: The device or software used to acquire the data

settings.comment: Any specific settings or conditions for the acquisition

quantity.comment: The quantity of reagent or data to be acquired

example: [Acquire]{operation} the [plate containing the diluted cell suspension]{reagent1} on a [flow cytometer fitted with the appropriate laser lines for the fluorescent cell label and DNA dye chosen]{device}.

device.comment: The device to be switched

mode.comment: The mode to be switched to

example: [Switch]{operation} the [objective lens]{device} to [40x one]{mode}.

referenceType.comment: The type of reference to be seen (e.g., table, figure, step, troubleshooting, etc.)

referenceID.comment: The ID or name of the reference

example: [See]{operation} [Table 2]{referenceType, referenceID}.

protocol.comment: Standard transformation protocols to be followed

scale.comment: Scale to which data is to be transformed

reagent0/data0.comment: The reagent/data into which transformation is to be done

example: [Transform]{operation} the [entire 6 μL reaction product]{reagent1} into a [high-efficiency cloning strain]{reagent2} following [standard transformation protocols]{protocol}.

reagent1.comment: The reagent to be transfected(usually cells)

reagent2.comment: The plasmid to be transfected into the cells

reagent3.comment: The other reagent used for transfection(usually transfectant)

method.comment: The method used for transfection, default=standard procedures

example: [Transfect]{operation} the [HeLa cells]{reagent1} at [50-60% confluency]{notice} with [CD63-pHluorin plasmid DNA]{reagent2}.

device2.comment: The object to fit into device1

example: [Fit]{operation} the [flask]{device1} with a [water condenser]{device2} in the main neck and also a [rubber septum]{device2} in the second neck.

model.comment: The model to fit the data to

example: [Fit]{operation} [binding curves of anisotropy versus protein concentration]{data1} to a [single-ligand binding model]{model}.

method.comment: The method of exposure

example: [Expose]{operation} the [wafer]{reagent1} to [UV]{method} for [6 sec]{time} using the [thin layer photomask]{device}.

method.comment: Method used to divide the reagent

quantity.comment: Number of parts to divide the reagent into

container.comment: Container to place the divided parts into

example: [Divide]{operation} the [resulting solution]{reagent1} to [5 aliquots]{quantity} in [200-μl PCR tubes]{container}.
[Dialyze]{operation} [sample]{reagent1} against [6 M Urea]{reagent2} in [rehydrated D-tubeTM Dialyzer Mini tubes]{container} for [2 h]{time} on a [stirrer]{device} at [room temperature]{temperature}.

reagent2.comment: Medium in which the reagent1 is picked into

example: [Pick]{operation} up individual [adult animals expressing Raichu-Ras probe]{reagent1} to a [bacteria-free NGM plate]{reagent2} to [remove bacteria]{purpose}.

reagent1.comment: The reagent to be dropped, keep alive

volume.comment: The volume of the reagent to be dropped

destination.comment: The target where the reagent is dropped

angle.comment: The angle at which the target is tilted

density.comment: The desired cell density if dropping cell suspension

example: [Drop]{operation} [1 μL]{volume} of [50% glycerol PBS solution]{reagent1} on a [glass slide]{destination}.

method.comment: The method used to assess the sample

attribute.comment: The attribute to be assessed. such as quality

device.comment: The device used for assessment

example: [Assess]{operation} the [quality]{attribute} of [these PCR-libraries]{reagent1} by [analyzing 1 µL on a High Sensitivity DNA chip]{method} on a [2100 Bioanalyzer system]{device}.

device.comment: Device used for recovery

destination.comment: Where the recovered sample is placed

method.comment: Method used for recovery

example: [Recover]{operation} [mononuclear cells from interface]{reagent1} using a [10 ml serological pipette]{device}.

position.comment: The position in which the object should be held

example: [Hold]{operation} the [mouse]{reagent1} in a [supine]{position} position, [allowing the head to tilt slightly backwards]{notice}.

reagent1.comment: The other reagent used in wipping

example: [Wipe]{operation} the [biosafety cabinet]{target} [thoroughly]{notice} with [70% ethanol]{reagent1}.

targetConcentration/volume.comment: The final concentration or volume of the reagent1

example: [Reduce]{operation} [disulfide bonds]{reagent1} by adding [DTT]{reagent2} to a final concentration of [10 mM]{targetConcentration}.

value.comment: The value to which the parameter is increased, defult=appropriate value

example: [Increase]{operation} [temperature]{attribute} to [67]{value}.
[Dehydrate]{operation} the [slides]{reagent1} in [70%, 95% and 100% (vol/vol) ethanol]{reagent2} for [30 s each]{time}.

mode.comment: Sequencing mode, e.g. single-end or paired-end

device.comment: Sequencing device used

example: [Sequence]{operation} [purified DNA plasmids]{reagent1} using [primers listed in Table 2]{reagent2}.

reagent1.comment: The reagent(always animal) to be induced

reagent2.comment: Additional reagents used for induction, such as anesthetic

state.comment: The state induced in reagent1(always animal), such as anesthesia

method.comment: Specific method or protocol for induction

example: [Induce]{operation} [anaesthesia]{state} in [mice]{reagent1} by inhalation of [3% isoflurane]{reagent2} for [2-3min]{time}.

designType.comment: The type of design to be made

regionOfInterest.comment: Region of interest for primer design

modification.comment: Any modifications to be made to the design

primerType.comment: Type of primers to be designed

example: [Design]{operation} [specific primers]{designType} flanking the [Cas9•sgRNA cutsite (target amplicon)]{regionOfInterest}.

thickness.comment: Thickness of the material to be deposited

reagent2.comment: The substrate on which the material is deposited

method.comment: The method used for deposition

example: [Deposit]{operation} [metals (Cr/Au, 15/100 nm)]{reagent1} on the [prepared substrate]{reagent2} using [electron beam evaporator]{method}.

data1.comment: The first data to be compared, keep alive

data2.comment: The second data to be compared, keep alive

example: [Compare]{operation} [spin-system types of a connectivity fragment]{data1} with [the protein sequence]{data2}.

reagent2.comment: The reagent to which object1 is aligned, keep alive

method.comment: The methodused for alignment

example: [Align]{operation} the [samples]{reagent1} to the [genome]{reagent2} using [‘STAR.’]{method}.

reagent2.comment: The material used to wrap the item

example: [Wrap]{operation} the [tube]{reagent1} with [PTFE tape]{reagent2}.

reagent1.comment: The reagent(always animal) to be sacrificed

method.comment: The method used to sacrifice the animal

example: [Sacrifice]{operation} [two 8-16 week old reprogrammable mice/Oct4GFP mice]{reagent1} by [ventilating them with CO2]{method}.

device.comment: The device used to read

data1.comment: The target to be read(usually file)

attribute.comment: Additional attributes for reading, such as wavelength, channel, etc.

method.comment: The method used to read, such as command line, setting, etc.

example: [Read]{operation} the [optical density]{data1} at [405 nm]{attribute} with a [plate reader]{device}.

container.comment: The container to setup, e.g., PCR tube, Eppendorf tube, PCR plate, glass plates, hotplate, perfusion station, culture dishes, manipulation dish

reagent1.comment: The main reagent to be setup

example: [Setup]{operation} [pre-PCR master mixes]{reagent1} in a [1.5 ml Eppendorf tube]{container} [on ice]{environment} by [mixing the following components]{method}.

container.comment: The container where the reagent is packed

example: [Pack]{operation} [NeutrAvidin Agarose Resin]{reagent1} into a [1.5 ml tube]{container}.

software.comment: The software where the file will be imported

purpose.comment: The purpose of importing the file

reference.comment: Additional reference for importing the file

example: [Import]{operation} [mass spectrometry raw data]{data1} for [quantitation]{purpose}.

device.comment: The device used for homogenization

strokes.comment: Number of strokes used during homogenization

example: [Homogenize]{operation} [mouse liver tissue]{reagent1} to [a cell suspension]{reagent0} in [ice-cold PBS]{reagent2} by using a [dounce homogenizer or a pellet pestle]{device}.

reagent2.comment: The recipient(usually mouse) of the reagent

example: [Give]{operation} [1 piece of vehicle jelly]{reagent1} to [each mouse]{reagent2} in [the morning of the following 3 days]{timing}.
[Denature]{operation} [streptavidin]{reagent1} in the pellets with [10 μl 10 mM EDTA, 95% formamide]{reagent2} at [90°C]{temperature} for [3 min]{time}.

size.comment: The size to which the object should be trimmed

method.comment: The method or tool used to trim the object

example: [Trim]{operation} the [diaphragmatic patch]{reagent1} to a [decent size]{size}.

reagent2.comment: The other reagent(s) to be added

example: [Supplement]{operation} [E8 medium]{reagent1} with the [ROCK inhibitor Y-27632 (1:1000)]{reagent2} to a final concentration of [10 μM]{targetConcentration}.

timing.comment: When the reconstitution should be done, if applicable

example: [Reconstitute]{operation} [40 µg of trypsin]{reagent1} with [20 µl dissolution buffer]{reagent2}.

format.comment: The format to export the data in

step.comment: The step in the process where the data is exported

example: [Export]{operation} [images]{data1} in [.tif]{imageFormat} format.
